components.description:
A leopard, a large cat with a yellowish-brown coat and black-and-gold spots. Depicted in full profile on all fours facing left, with a long tail and its distinctive pattern.

Sometimes used to represent jaguars, panthers, cheetahs, and related cats. May also be used to indicate leopard prints in fashion. Not to be confused with üêÖ Tiger.

Google’s design is noticeably more cartoon-styled. Microsoft’s design was previously solid yellowish-brown in color, resembling a cougar or mountain lion.
components.title: Leopard

Sometimes used to represent jaguars, panthers, cheetahs, and related cats. May also be used to indicate leopard prints in fashion. Not to be confused with üêÖ Tiger.

title: Leopard

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A leopard emoji which has a yellow or gold colored coat¬†with black spots. Leopard was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to E http://emojipedia.org/leopard/
emoji_net_data.name: leopard

bn:00050713n: The leopard is the smallest of the four "big cats" in the genus Panthera.
Large feline of African and Asian forests usually having a tawny coat with black spots
A large wild cat with a spotted coat, Panthera pardus, indigenous to Africa and Asia.
The leopard is one of the five "big cats" in the genus Panthera.
The scientific name for the Leopard
A large wild cat with a spotted coat, Panthera pardus.
Panthera pardus, a large wild cat with a spotted coat, indigenous to Africa and Asia.

bn:00000926n: Large feline of the genus Acinonyx
Long-legged spotted cat of Africa and southwestern Asia having nonretractile claws; the swiftest mammal; can be trained to run down game
The cheetah is a large feline inhabiting most of Africa and parts of Iran.
A member of the cat family, a poor climber that hunts by speed and stealth.

A distinctive member (Acinonyx jubatus) of the cat family, slightly smaller than the leopard, but with proportionately longer limbs and a smaller head; it is native to Africa and also credited with being the fastest terrestrial animal.
